channel.title: Need Help Installing Ubuntu
channel.description:
Ok, I have asked this at Ubuntu's forums but got no results,
I have Ubuntu on a flash drive, it boots and everything, my hard drive is partitioned so I can run it as a dual boot, and my computers specs are, AMD Phenom X4 II 965 Quad Core, 6 GB of RAM, Integrated Radeon HD 4200 Video Card, and an Asus MOBO.
Here is my problem, when I go to install when I boot up my flash drive, I get 2 lines of word that show up, and then about 4 lines of random codes then my computer will just sit their and do nothing after that, forcing me to restart, any help?

item.title: Need Help Installing Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I have found the issue, my USB would not format correctly or something, but I found a computer with a cd write drive, wrote it to a disk, and now I am the proud owner of a Linux operating system

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Installing Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

Is it possible that the Ubuntu image is corrupt? What program did you use to create it? Tried unetbootin?

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Installing Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

the codes go something like,

/casper/intrd...
/casper/vilinuz.....
(Bunch of random meaningless symbols)

The random code’s look like alt codes… such as, Æ╥¥╒ etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Installing Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

What are those two lines? And the random codes?

Read full topic
